title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.7 COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Output 5.7 Communication For Development, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5. Program Effectiveness

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral social and behaviour change

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.7 Communication For Development

description.narrative: UNICEF-supported social and behaviour change programmes resulted in high reach of multimedia campaigns on immunization, ECD, emergencies, disease outbreaks, violence against women and children. Specific to COVID-19, more than 14 million people were reached through messaging. Over 1.9 million people were engaged in COVID-19 RCCE activities, over 84 000 people shared their concerns, asked questions and received feedback through established mechanisms. The Adolescent Volunteer Initiative saw the successful capacity building of adolescent volunteers in support of nutrition and health programming. Capacity of over 37 000 community workers at national and sub-national levels in social and behavior change communication was strengthened. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
